div: You can choose to view the spectrum on either a Linear or Log graph by navigating to the menu View → Chart Options; the graph is log by default.
You can add gridlines to the graph by navigating to the View toolbar, hovering over Chart Options, and selecting the Show Vertical Lines and Show Horizontal Lines.

The legend located near the top right of your graph should automatically load data corresponding to your spectrum. In the legend you will see the "Real Time" and "Live Time;" the difference between the two will give you what is otherwise known as "dead time." The legend will also provide data on the number of counts pertaining to a certain spectrum.

To make the graph constitute the entire window, select the Hide Tool Tabs option found under the View toolbar. The application provides numerous routes to access tools such that you can still access all of the tools from the Tools menu while the tool tabs are hidden.

To manually check notifications, select menu Help → Notifications Logs. Notification preferences can be modified by checking/unchecking the types of notifications that you desired to be disabled on the bottom right corner of the Notifications Log.
To toggle individual detectors on/off, check/uncheck the desired detector from the menu View → Detectors; all detectors are on by default.
